background.text: Order below Exh.01 in Bail Application No. 10/2019 (CNR NO.­MHPU01­017650­2019) 1] Applicants­Bhimraj Gangaram Nath and Janak Ratna Dhakal have filed this application for bail under section 439 of Cr.P.C. in connection with CR No.588/2018 registered with Sangvi Police Station, Pune, under section 399, 402 of IPC, under section 37 (1) r/w. S. 135 of Bombay Police Act and under section 4 (25) of Arms Act.

under section 37 (1) r/w. S. 135 of Bombay Police Act

arguments.text: 2] It is the case of prosecution that, Complainant Farook Ambir Mulla Police Naik of Crime Branch, Unit no.2, Pimpri Chinchwad, filed complaint alleging therein that on 04/12/2018 at 00.40 hours near compound wall of Narmada Garden Lawns, applicant along with other persons found in possession of incriminating articles and they were in preparation of committing dacoity at Shree Jewellers hence applicants were arrested by Sangavi police station on 04/12/2018.

argumentSentences.text: 2] It is the case of prosecution that, Complainant Farook Ambir Mulla Police Naik of Crime Branch, Unit no.2, Pimpri Chinchwad, filed complaint alleging therein that on 04/12/2018 at 00.40 hours near compound wall of Narmada Garden Lawns, applicant along with other persons found in possession of incriminating articles and they were in preparation of committing dacoity at Shree Jewellers hence applicants were arrested by Sangavi police station on 04/12/2018.

arguments.text: 3] Advocate for the applicants in his argument stated that co­accused of these two accused Mr. Ramesh Ahuja was granted bail by this court. These applicants are also similarly placed hence on the ground of parity they be released on bail. Investigation is almost completed and nothing remained to be recovered or discovered from these applicants. Hence, they may be released on bail. 2

argumentSentences.text: 3] Advocate for the applicants in his argument stated that co­accused of these two accused Mr. Ramesh Ahuja was granted bail by this court.
These applicants are also similarly placed hence on the ground of parity they be released on bail.
Investigation is almost completed and nothing remained to be recovered or discovered from these applicants.
Hence, they may be released on bail.

arguments.text: 4] Ld. DGP strongly opposed this application. It is her contention that these applicants are originally belonging to Nepal. If they will be released on bail, they will flee away from justice. Therefore, their bail application was rightly rejected by learned magistrate. If they will be released on bail, there is possibility of repetition of offence. So also there is possibility of tampering prosecution witnesses and evidence. Therefore, this application may be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Ld. DGP strongly opposed this application.
It is her contention that these applicants are originally belonging to Nepal.
If they will be released on bail, they will flee away from justice.
Therefore, their bail application was rightly rejected by learned magistrate.
If they will be released on bail, there is possibility of repetition of offence.
So also there is possibility of tampering prosecution witnesses and evidence.
Therefore, this application may be rejected.

arguments.text: 5] In this application and in police papers, the address of these applicants is mentioned as Sanghvi, Pune and Kalyan Phata, Panvel Road, Mumbai respectively. They are permanent resident of Tikapur Nepal and District Survet, Nepal but merely for this reason bail cannot be refused to them. Nothing remained to be recovered or discovered from them. Therefore, their further detention in jail is not necessary. By imposing stringent conditions they can be released on bail. Hence, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5] In this application and in police papers, the address of these applicants is mentioned as Sanghvi, Pune and Kalyan Phata, Panvel Road, Mumbai respectively.
They are permanent resident of Tikapur Nepal and District Survet, Nepal but merely for this reason bail cannot be refused to them.
Nothing remained to be recovered or discovered from them.
Therefore, their further detention in jail is not necessary.
By imposing stringent conditions they can be released on bail.
Hence, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Applicants­Bhimraj Gangaram Nath and Janak Ratna Dhakal be released on bail in CR No.588/2018 registered with Sangvi Police Station, Pune, under section 399, 402 of IPC, under section 37 (1) r/w. S. 135 of Bombay Police Act and under section 4 (25) of Arms Act, on furnishing PR bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty five thousands only) each with one or two sureties in like amount. Out of them at least one should be local surety. 3 Bail application no. 10/2019 3] They shall attend the concern police station on 3rd Monday of each month till filing of the charge­sheet. 4] They are further directed to furnish name, address, contact number of his two blood relatives who are residing in India along with their address proof. 5] They shall furnish his detailed address of Nepal and produce address proof if any. 6] They shall produce their passport if any before IO within 8 days from this order. 7] Bail before Ld. magistrate..

footer: Sd/­ ( S. S. Gosavi ) Date : 30­01­2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. C E R T I F I C A T E I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of steno : S. Y. processedText:
Bail application no. 10/2019 
---header-ends---
Order below Exh.01 in Bail Application No. 10/2019 (CNR NO.­MHPU01­017650­2019) 1] Applicants­Bhimraj Gangaram Nath and Janak Ratna Dhakal have filed this application for bail under section 439 of Cr.P.C. in connection with CR No.588/2018 registered with Sangvi Police Station, Pune, under section 399, 402 of IPC, under section 37 (1) r/w. S. 135 of Bombay Police Act and under section 4 (25) of Arms Act. 
---background-ends---
2] It is the case of prosecution that, Complainant Farook Ambir Mulla Police Naik of Crime Branch, Unit no.2, Pimpri Chinchwad, filed complaint alleging therein that on 04/12/2018 at 00.40 hours near compound wall of Narmada Garden Lawns, applicant along with other persons found in possession of incriminating articles and they were in preparation of committing dacoity at Shree Jewellers hence applicants were arrested by Sangavi police station on 04/12/2018. 
---argument-ends---
3] Advocate for the applicants in his argument stated that co­accused of these two accused Mr. Ramesh Ahuja was granted bail by this court. These applicants are also similarly placed hence on the ground of parity they be released on bail. Investigation is almost completed and nothing remained to be recovered or discovered from these applicants. Hence, they may be released on bail. 2 
---argument-ends---
4] Ld. DGP strongly opposed this application. It is her contention that these applicants are originally belonging to Nepal. If they will be released on bail, they will flee away from justice. Therefore, their bail application was rightly rejected by learned magistrate. If they will be released on bail, there is possibility of repetition of offence. So also there is possibility of tampering prosecution witnesses and evidence. Therefore, this application may be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
5] In this application and in police papers, the address of these applicants is mentioned as Sanghvi, Pune and Kalyan Phata, Panvel Road, Mumbai respectively. They are permanent resident of Tikapur Nepal and District Survet, Nepal but merely for this reason bail cannot be refused to them. Nothing remained to be recovered or discovered from them. Therefore, their further detention in jail is not necessary. By imposing stringent conditions they can be released on bail. Hence, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] Applicants­Bhimraj Gangaram Nath and Janak Ratna Dhakal be released on bail in CR No.588/2018 registered with Sangvi Police Station, Pune, under section 399, 402 of IPC, under section 37 (1) r/w. S. 135 of Bombay Police Act and under section 4 (25) of Arms Act, on furnishing PR bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty five thousands only) each with one or two sureties in like amount. Out of them at least one should be local surety. 3 Bail application no. 10/2019 3] They shall attend the concern police station on 3rd Monday of each month till filing of the charge­sheet. 4] They are further directed to furnish name, address, contact number of his two blood relatives who are residing in India along with their address proof. 5] They shall furnish his detailed address of Nepal and produce address proof if any. 6] They shall produce their passport if any before IO within 8 days from this order. 7] Bail before Ld. magistrate.. 
---order-ends---
Sd/­ ( S. S. Gosavi ) Date : 30­01­2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. C E R T I F I C A T E I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of steno : S. Y. Shaikh, Stenographer (Grade­I) Name of the Court : S. S. Gosavi, District Judge ­ 4 & Additional Sessions Judge, Pune Date of Order : 30.01.2019 Order signed by P.O. on : 31.01.2019 Order uploaded on : 31.01.2019
